item.title: A Ukrainian father's terrifying journey to a Russian prison and back
item.description: Nikita Horban was abducted from his village and taken to Russia. He would come back without any toes.

item.title: Ukraine war: Russian strike on Kyiv kills reporter Vira Hyrych
item.description: Vira Hyrych, who worked for Radio Liberty, died after her residential building was hit on Thursday.

item.title: British Virgin Islands: UK should take back rule - report
item.description: The British overseas territory's government should be dissolved for two years, a report recommends.

item.title: Foul-smelling foam clogs up Colombian town of Mosquera
item.description: Detergents dumped in a local river are being linked to the filthy white phenomenon.

item.title: Alexanda Kotey: IS 'Beatle' sentenced to life in US for murders in Syria
item.description: Alexanda Kotey, 38, pleaded guilty last September to the beheading of IS hostages in Syria.

item.title: South Africa's Jacob Zuma would do anything for the Guptas - Zondo report
item.description: South Africa's ex-president Jacob Zuma would "do anything" for the Gupta business family, a report finds.

item.title: Liberia war crimes: Sierra Leone rebel commander acquitted by court in Finland
item.description: Gibril Massaquoi was a school teacher but then became the spokesman of a notorious rebel group.

item.title: Heat wave in India leaves millions struggling to cope
item.description: Experts say India is now recording more intense, frequent heatwaves that are also longer in duration.

item.title: Israel airport chaos as family brings unexploded shell
item.description: Chaos erupts as Americans bring a 'souvenir' unexploded shell into Israel's international airport.

item.title: Shanghai lockdown: Residents protest after five weeks of strict zero-Covid measures
item.description: Some residents have been under strict lockdown for five weeks, and struggled to access food supplies.

item.title: James Corden leaving Late Late Show after eight years
item.description: The British comedian and actor turned talk show host announced the decision on Thursday.

item.title: Depp v Heard: What you might have missed this week
item.description: The court hears evidence of personality disorders, drug abuse and a relationship with Elon Musk.

item.title: Why British royals face simmering resentment in Caribbean
item.description: More awareness of the region's history and calls for slavery reparations have changed sentiment.

item.title: Ukraine launches hunt for Russian soldiers accused of Bucha war crimes
item.description: The 10 Russian soldiers are wanted for alleged war crimes - but at home, they have been hailed as heroes.

item.title: How big are Donald Trump's legal problems?
item.description: As he plots his political future, two criminal probes and multiple lawsuits could spell trouble.

item.title: Barkha Dutt: 'My father did not have to die'
item.description: A year after losing her father to Covid, Indian journalist Barkha Dutt writes on coping with loss and regret.

item.title: The children surviving Ukraineâ€™s war without their parents
item.description: Eleven-year-old Angelina is one of many children who were forced to flee hundreds of miles from their homes on Ukraine's front line.

item.title: Sirens ring out in Israel to honour Holocaust victims
item.description: Streets came to a standstill as people paused to pay tribute to the millions killed in the Holocaust.

item.title: War in Ukraine absurd and evil, says UN chief
item.description: Antonio Guterres addresses reporters outside a wreckage of apartment blocks north west of Kyiv.

item.title: Ukrainians flock to get patriotic tattoos
item.description: People headed to the front line, and their supporters, are having the country's war with Russia memorialise.

item.title: Critically endangered monkey born in Colombian zoo
item.description: A cotton-top tamarin monkey has made its first public appearance at Cali Zoo in Colombia.
